page.title: 06CONSERVATION-SAND DUNES
page.content: A section of our allocated block forms part of a Local Nature Reserve (known as the Ainsdale and Birkdale Sandhills).This is one of the largest areas of unspoilt duneland left in Britain and 500 acres were designated as a reserve in 1980 to conserve the characteristic landscape and wildlife. Since 1978 the Council has been involved in a joint venture with Merseyside County Council and the Countryside Commission (the Coastal Management Scheme).An important aspect of the work of this scheme is Dune Conservation.Dune erosion (by sea,wind and human trampling) leads to a loss of coastal defences,damage to property and the loss of many valuable wildlife habitats.Dune restoration involves two main processes,sand trapping and marram planting.Sand is trapped behind fences and the marram seeds planted.
